news.title: Maharashtra forms panel to examine TDR relief for properties facing redevelopment hurdles
news.para: Maharashtra government has formed a 12-member committee to re-survey river flood lines across the state, including Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad. The panel will review existing norms and suggest amendments to the UDCPR for TDR utilization on properties built before the 2009 flood line demarcation. This move aims to resolve redevelopment hurdles for numerous properties.

news.title: Muthoot Microfin looks to buy company offering loan against property
news.para: Muthoot Microfin is exploring inorganic growth by acquiring a majority stake in two non-banking financial companies. This move aims to expand its micro loan against property business. The company is diversifying its portfolio following recent RBI policy changes. Muthoot Microfin plans to significantly increase its secured lending. This strategy will reduce reliance on unsecured microfinance loans.

news.title: Nashik civic body serves notices to 500 more property tax defaulters, taking total to 950
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation has issued notices to an additional 500 property tax defaulters owing over Rs 1 lakh, giving them 21 days to pay or face warrants. This brings the total notices to 950 as the NMC races to collect Rs 52 crore to meet its Rs 270 crore target by year-end.

news.title: Vacant Bengaluru development body sites: Slab-based penalties replace 10% levy
news.para: The Bangalore Development Authority has revised its penalty structure for delayed house construction under lease-cum-sale agreements. A new graded penalty, ranging from 2.5% to 10% based on site size, replaces the previous flat 10% levy. This change aims to bring proportionality and address concerns from site allottees regarding financial burdens.

news.title: Only four stations in phase 1: NMRC to redraw Greater Noida West metro route
news.para: Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) will revise the Greater Noida West metro corridor's detailed project report, focusing on four stations in phase 1. This comes as a proposed rapid rail corridor to Jewar via Greater Noida West faces scrutiny over station duplication. Residents express frustration over project delays and lack of public transport.

news.title: About 1.04 crore to get PMAY houses in Bihar: Rural development minister
news.para: In an ambitious step towards enhancing housing infrastructure, Bihar's Rural Development Minister revealed that the state is awaiting central approval for the construction of 1.04 crore pucca houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY).

news.title: DDA to remove parking charges from flat prices in ongoing housing schemes
news.para: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) has removed parking charges from flat costs, potentially reducing prices by Rs 5 lakh to Rs 12 lakh. This move aims to boost sales for ongoing housing schemes, with buyers who already paid parking fees set to receive reimbursements or adjustments. The cost of parking will now be absorbed into overall development expenses.

news.title: Kochi: Allocation of apartment units in Rajiv Awas Yojana housing complex to be delayed
news.para: Beneficiary allocation for the Rajiv Awas Yojana housing complex faces further delays as the sewage treatment plant's trial run is scheduled for March 10. While 198 of the 398 listed beneficiaries have completed document submission and allotment, the remaining must pay their share for common amenities.

news.title: Eden Realty Group to invest ₹5,000 crore in residential, hospitality projects by 2030
news.para: Eden Realty Group has announced a significant Rs 5,000 crore investment by 2030 for projects across West Bengal. This includes a large residential development in Howrah's Shalimar and the company's entry into the hospitality sector with five luxury hotels totaling 600 rooms along the Hooghly river.

news.title: Delhi court rejects ex-Jaypee Infratech MD's bail plea in money-laundering case
news.para: A Delhi court has denied bail to Manoj Gaur, former MD of Jaypee Infratech. He faces money-laundering charges linked to a Rs 14,599 crore fraud involving thousands of homebuyers. Funds collected for projects were allegedly diverted, leaving construction incomplete. The court cited Gaur's involvement in multiple cases and a tainted past as reasons for the dismissal.

news.title: Budget 2026 keeps the growth trajectory intact, ensures stability
news.para: The Union Budget for FY27 outlines a clear path for economic stability and growth. It emphasizes reforms and increased investments, particularly in infrastructure. The budget prioritizes tier II and III cities, aiming to create new economic hubs. Initiatives like the Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund and CPSE REITs are set to boost confidence and unlock potential.

news.title: Pune: PMC issues show-cause notice, fines builder over contaminated water supply in Mhalunge complex
news.para: Pune civic body fined VTP Aethereus Rs1 lakh and issued a show-cause notice for supplying contaminated water to residents. The developer claims the issue is resolved, citing a technical glitch at their water treatment plant. They assert water quality meets standards and are formally addressing the PMC's concerns.

news.title: Unitech CEO's tenure extended by one year
news.para: Realty firm Unitech Ltd announced its board has approved a one-year extension for CEO Ashok Kumar Yadav. This extension is effective from February 11, 2026. The company is currently facing significant cash flow issues. These financial challenges have led to considerable delays in completing housing projects, particularly in the Delhi-NCR region.

news.title: Homebuyers await execution of recovery warrants even two months after MahaRERA issued SOP to expedite process
news.para: Homebuyers in Pune are facing prolonged delays in receiving compensation from defaulting developers, as recovery warrants remain stalled at the execution stage. Despite MahaRERA's new SOP, revenue authorities are slow to act, leaving many, especially senior citizens, in limbo. The Supreme Court has questioned RERA's effectiveness in enforcing orders.

news.title: RBI eases ECB rules, lifts borrowing limits to $1 billion from $750 million earlier
news.para: The Reserve Bank of India has updated its External Commercial Borrowings rules. Borrowing limits have been raised, and maturity requirements are now more flexible. These changes aim to support the growing trend of Indian companies raising funds through ECBs. The new norms offer greater ease for businesses seeking foreign capital.

news.title: High court orders inspection of Bengaluru paying guest premises for rule violations
news.para: The Karnataka High Court has ordered an inspection of Paying Guest accommodations in Bengaluru. This inspection will verify if these facilities adhere to guidelines set by civic authorities. The court wants to ensure constructions match sanctioned plans and bylaws. Occupancy norms, hygiene, and safety measures will be checked.

news.title: Indore: 16 houses to be removed next week for underground metro station
news.para: Sixteen houses in Indore's Piliyakhal will be demolished for a Metro station, displacing 28 families. Residents, holding leases under Rajiv Gandhi Ashray Mission, are being offered flats in Rangwasa. They demand individual flats for all 28 families and express concerns about commuting and children's education.

news.title: Delay in SNA account creation may stall construction of 9.16 lakh PMAY-G houses in Bihar
news.para: Bihar's Rural Development Department faces a significant hurdle in constructing over 9.16 lakh houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana (Gramin) this financial year. The delay stems from the Finance Department's failure to create a Single Nodal Agency (SNA) account, hindering timely fund disbursal to beneficiaries.

news.title: Hong Kong court dismisses bid to liquidate Country Garden
news.para: A Hong Kong court dismissed a petition to liquidate Chinese property giant Country Garden on Monday, weeks after the firm said it had restructured its massive offshore debt obligations. High Court judge Linda Chan took less than a minute on Monday to dismiss the petition, which was initiated in 2024 by Country Garden creditor Ever Credit Limited.

news.title: Bhopal: Lakeview Residency to be razed & rebuilt as five-star hotel
news.para: A consortium including Genex Hotels, Dilip Buildcon, and IHCL will redevelop the MPT Lake View Residency Hotel. The project aims to create a minimum 5-star property with a convention center. This development is expected to significantly boost Bhopal's tourism and its standing as a MICE destination.
